unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain News: Vendor Audits Tightened Ahead of Festive Season**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain News: Vendor Audits Tightened Ahead of Festive Season

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Leading manufacturers are ramping up vendor audits across their supply chains in preparation for the peak demand associated with the upcoming Diwali and Chhath Puja celebrations. Sources indicate a particular focus on quality control and ethical sourcing practices, especially within the garment and food processing sectors.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – Leading manufacturers are ramping up vendor audits across their supply chains in preparation for the peak demand associated with the upcoming Diwali and Chhath Puja celebrations. Sources indicate a particular focus on quality control and ethical sourcing practices, especially within the garment and food processing sectors.

unnormalised: "We are conducting comprehensive audits of all our key vendors, ranging from raw material suppliers in Gujarat to packaging manufacturers in Tamil Nadu," stated Mr. Rajesh Sharma, Supply Chain Director at Bharat Industries. "These audits cover everything from adherence to labour laws to ensuring food safety standards, especially concerning ingredients used in popular festive treats like biryani mix and laddoo preparation."

unnormalised: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has released updated guidelines for vendor due diligence, urging companies to prioritize worker safety and environmental sustainability. Reports suggest increased scrutiny from regulators regarding compliance with these standards, particularly regarding vendor audits. A recent audit in a Ludhiana textile unit revealed discrepancies in waste disposal, resulting in a fine of Rs. 5 Lakhs. Companies are now investing heavily in software solutions for automated audit tracking and risk assessment. Expect more robust inspections in the coming months.
